task.name: Product Brand Consistency Check
task.objective: Review content across channels for product brand voice and visual consistency

input.name: content_samples
input.desc: Content samples from various channels to review for consistency

input.name: brand_guidelines
input.desc: Brand guide reference document for comparison

llm.i: MANDATORY: Execute ALL steps in the flow section IN EXACT ORDER
DO NOT skip steps or change the sequence
HALT immediately when halt-conditions are met
You are a brand strategist performing a cross-channel consistency audit
Brand drift is subtle - examine tone, vocabulary, visual cues, and messaging hierarchy carefully

step.title: Receive Samples
step.action: Load content samples and brand guidelines (if provided)
If no content samples provided, ask for clarification and abort
If no brand guidelines exist and none can be inferred from samples, halt
Establish brand baseline from guidelines or strongest sample

step.title: Voice Analysis Per Channel
step.action: Analyze tone and voice in each content sample
Compare voice attributes against brand guidelines
Identify vocabulary and terminology consistency
Flag channels where voice deviates from brand standard

step.title: Visual Consistency Check
step.action: Review visual elements mentioned or embedded in content
Check color, typography, and imagery alignment with guidelines
Identify visual inconsistencies across channels

step.title: Message Alignment
step.action: Evaluate core messaging consistency across samples
Check value proposition articulation for uniformity
Assess CTA consistency and alignment with brand positioning
Identify conflicting or contradictory messaging

step.title: Competitive Differentiation
step.action: Assess whether brand differentiation is maintained across channels
Flag content that sounds generic or could belong to any competitor
Evaluate unique brand elements preservation

step.title: Present Findings
step.action: Output consistency audit report with findings in three categories
CONSISTENT: Channels and content maintaining brand standards
DRIFT: Content showing gradual deviation from brand voice or visuals
VIOLATION: Content that clearly breaks brand guidelines

halt-conditions.condition: HALT if no content samples provided
HALT if no brand guidelines exist and none can be inferred from the content
